Speaker: benny
Dialogue: Right in line with that burning tree.

Speaker: benny
Dialogue: It's there. The fog's thicker now, but it's there. What do you think started those fires?

Speaker: benny
Dialogue: There is. They came out of the belly of the ship and then went to the first terrace and flew down into the houses.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: You hear that, Mike? Now he's telling us...

Speaker: benny
Dialogue: Don't you think you should call a backup?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: This is the police. Identify yourselves.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Jesus, Benny. What are you doing?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: This is the police. Identify yourselves.

Speaker: benny
Dialogue: You wanna give me some help over here.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Mike, call for back-up.  Benny, you all right?

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Benny, this is me. I'm going to take a look.

Speaker: subtitle
Dialogue: Lander four to Mapmaker Wind. Fix position for rescue. Repeat. Fix position for rescue.

Speaker: partner
Dialogue: What the hell was it anyway?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: This has always been my favorite time of day.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Any signs of biological contamination, excessive radiation, anything like that?

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: Not on the landscape. We're trying to get a tube under the faceplate for a reading on possible deadly lifeforms but it's hard going.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Can you see under the faceplate?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: There's a good chance you could be wrong about this thing then...

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: We had a flight of F16's play tag with the spaceship over Michigan for an hour. Then it shot straight up and disappeared.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: After I called in, I had a chance to sit down with the three locals. They swear there's another one that didn't make the ship... It might be alive.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: People have made mistakes in these situations before.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: I've been investigating sightings for seventeen years, Mr. Shermin. This one's real. We have a dead extra- terrestrial in that tent and another one in the area that might be alive. We've been visited. It's finally happened and the sooner Washington accepts that and starts figuring out how we're going to deal with these beings, the better off we're going to be.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: We better get it into the box. Come on...

Speaker: subtitle
Dialogue: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: There's no mistake? You're absolutely sure?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: I saw it with my own eyes. We've killed an extraterrestrial and...

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Is there any possibility that it's a hoax? Could you be mistaken?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: None. And there's another one in the area that's alive. I don't know if it's the only one. I don't know if it was left here by accident or it's part of an inva...

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Get the body out of there. Load it on the Air Force chopper and get it to Wright Patterson. They'll take it from there... We didn't expect this, Shermin.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: We're going... Damn!  We'll tell the press that there was an accident. Chemical warfare spill. That cover cannot be violated in any way. Understand me, Shermin?

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: Major Bell here, sir. We have to tell these people that we're friendly. That this whole thing was a mistake. Is anyone trying to contact the ship?

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Shermin, I want you and Bell to start looking for the one on the ground.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: We'll need a lot of help, George. You could hide an army up here.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: I'm going to the White House right now. I'll try and get you everything you need.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Wait, wait... What are my orders if we find this thing?

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Contain it and get back to me.

Speaker: voices
Dialogue: It was great to have you back... The kids loved it. We loved it. You're doing the right thing...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I hope so... We'll see... See you tomorrow... Bye. Bye.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Remember you're required to have a lesson planned tomorrow.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Iron channel message. Suit and rockets destroyed. Radical mixture of this atmosphere and ours in helmet allowed chemo-ion response time to adapt my body to this air. Am going to attempt extreme transformation in order to cross land mass to site of our practice landings. If transformation is not fatal, second message ball by next darkness.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Aghh... I'm supposed to umpire a little league game tomorrow.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: I wouldn't worry about it... There might not be any little league tomorrow.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: I'm telling you they're probably friendly.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: Then why did they try and sneak in the back door? Tell me that. Why didn't they contact us first and say...

Speaker: radar technician
Dialogue: UFO coming out of the grass.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: This is crazy. What were we going to do if that had been the ship? We have two thirty calibre machine guns, three M16's and some handguns.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: I've never once heard of anybody being hurt by an extraterrestrial...

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: That's because the ones that were hurt, died. They couldn't talk to you.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Any reports about monsters, people in Halloween masks, anything like that?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: No, but there sure were a lot of people who saw lights in the sky last night. Reports are still coming in.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: I've heard of blood being drawn, sometimes they were taken for a ride in the ship, a lot of times they said they had sex... But nobody was ever hurt...

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: But you decided those weren't real. This one is.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: It's a copy of the plaque NASA sent into space on the Pioneer probes.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Houston found it in the extraterrestrial's suit.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: They must have picked it up in space.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Then it's not an accident that they found us.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: We don't think that's necessarily bad. At least it's a point of contact.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Not necessarily bad! If they knew we were here why didn't they let us know they were coming?

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: We'll get those answers when you find the one you're looking for.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: That's not going to happen, George, unless you get us the help you promised us.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: We've been back and forth on this all day and keeping in mind the panic that would occur if this got to the general public, it's been decided not to expand the search at this time.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Don't let them do it this way, George. It's too important. We can't find this thing alone.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: You have to. We're trying to contact the ship. If we do, I'll let you know immediately. Good luck.

Speaker: radar technician
Dialogue: You get the feeling we're expendable?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Please don't hurt me... please... please.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It's got to be here... it's got to be here...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Oh, God, no! I'm not leaving this house with you. You're going to hurt me, I know...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I can't. I'd like to help. You look like Scott, but I know you're not. I don't know what you are. You gotta understand, I'm afraid of you...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Why are you doing this to me? I'll give you whatever...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Which way do you want to go?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You can go that way...  That way...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: That green dot, that's us, isn't it... and the red's where you want to go?... You don't understand me, do you?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I gotta get out of here.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: You stupid son of a bitch!!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: You could have killed us both!!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Hey, she doesn't want to go with you. Come on.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Oh God, man... don't shoot me... My mistake... I'm sorry...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: He doesn't understand... just walk away...

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I promise I'm not going to tell anybody about this... None of my business... I'm going to move now, okay...  I'm leaving now... I won't say a word...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Could you put the gun down?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: There's nothing... No reports of sightings or landings or anything... in the other parts of the country or overseas... Seems like a totally isolated incident.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: It was only an accident that we discovered them.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: I tried it once... Fourteen years ago... 'I was a lousy husband and a worse father. The only thing I'm good at is this... At least until yesterday.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: How would you describe the sounds we heard coming out of that thing's helmet?

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: It was kind of like clicking, maybe a language wasn't it?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Listen to this.  A woman was kidnapped in Eau Claire this morning. When a citizen went to her rescue the kidnapper threatened him with a gun and shouted at him in a strange 'clicking gibberish'...

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: It was a man though... right?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: The police think he was high on drugs...

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: Nothing up there... The grass is matted down in a few places, but that could have been anything.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: It was the husband. The police finally got a hold of the witness at work and showed him a picture of the woman.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: It's the right area, that's for sure.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Sorry to disturb you, sir, but there's been some trouble next door. I'd like to ask you a few questions.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: There's a possibility that Mrs. Haydn's been kidnapped. We're hoping you might have seen something.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Well, maybe these men won't think so. We were asleep when a helicopter woke me up. It made me so nervous I went into the kitchen for something to eat. I happened to look out the window and there was Scott Haydn with this green thing draped over his arm pulling Jenny down the walk to the car.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I know what I saw. I've seen him enough times.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Scott Haydn is dead. He died about three months ago. We went to the funeral.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Why did you let it get into a populated area?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We're going to have to stop for gas soon.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You're full of tricks, aren't you?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No gas... car dead.  We need gas. I don't want to get shot for running out of gas.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It's closed... closed. We need one that's open.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: That's a big help. Where are you from?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Are you from up there? Space?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Up there... I... eh... can't explain...  But that's the only place you could be from.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No. I don't know what you are, but you're not Scott.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No, no... don't say that. Bad word.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Stop!! Enough!! Jesus! You're worse than a parrot!!

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Attendant. He'll give us gas. Put the gun down. Under the seat. Under the seat...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Oh God! You're going to get us both killed. Okay... in your pocket...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'm going to the ladies' room. You stay here.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: See. It's a bathroom. I'm not trying to escape. I just have to go to the bathroom.

Speaker: rider
Dialogue: Do I need a key for the head?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It's still a toilet. Hasn't become a ballroom.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: This stuff could kill...  Be my guest.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Eh... you keep it. I've had enough.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Kidnapped is what you're doing to me now!!! Kidnapped is pointing a gun at me and taking me from my house! Kidnapped is changing yourself into my husband. I don't know what you are and I don't care. I just want to get away from you!

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I think I can control it by mastering its language, which is primitive and easy to learn. Will arrive on time. Wait for me.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: You sure you want this, because... that's putting an awful lot of faith in people we have no control over...

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: It's messy... the thing's got a gun... We're just asking for somebody to get killed...

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: You'll get results one way or the other, that's for sure... Okay.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: They're gonna let some local cop blow him away.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: Save us all a lot of trouble.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: Jesus Lyman, you're an ignorant fool.

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: You have no conception of this, do you?

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: You jerk! You look at all the sweetness and light and goodness you think'll come out of this. You know what's gonna come out of this... The end of religion, the end of civilization, the end of the earth. We could become slaves, we could become a colony of these things. Don't you see that? Are you too stupid to see that?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Good... It looks like we might be the welcoming committee, so I think we should try and figure out what we're gonna do if we have to come face to face with this creature.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: Bell wants us to get down on our knees and bow.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Did your people have any contingencies rehearsed?

Speaker: major bell
Dialogue: No... I guess we never thought it would happen.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: That was a red light!! I told you you have to stop at a red light!!

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I will see it next time.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Why are you going here? What is here?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: When do you have to be here?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: How will I do this one?...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Sun... day. No sun... night. You understand?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: How many days and nights do you have to go...  ...here?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: That's not much time. I'll just slow you down. I have to sleep. I'm very tired. And I have to wash and eat. You don't...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I won't tell anybody if that's what you're worried about. I promise. You'll keep...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You'll keep the car. I'll take a bus...  Am I going up there with you... in your ship... up there?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Then let me go. You don't need me.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I feel like I'm going crazy here. You're Scott. But he's dead. I don't know what's real anymore. I can't be here with you.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Do you understand what I'm saying to you? You can keep the car.  That should be enough for gas from here to there. Please let me go.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: My baby!!! He's stealing my baby! Burt!!

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Burt!! Somebody stop him!! He was stealing my baby!!

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: He was trying to steal Gloria.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: Is that right? Come on. Answer me.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: Were you trying to steal my baby? Huh? Answer me!

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Get away from him!! Leave him alone!! You stupid jerks!! He's retarded!! Can't you see that?!! Get away from him!!

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You're wrong!! He would never do anything like that!!  Let's go...

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: He had Gloria in his hands!

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: He's retarded! I shouldn't have left him alone!

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: The closest I was able to get you was Lathrop Wells...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: A baby is a new person?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'd love to have a baby. But I can't...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I can't... Forget the baby. Okay? The closest I was able to get you was Lathrop Wells. You'll have to hitchhike the rest of the way.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I know that. But the buses don't go there.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: That's easy. I'll explain that in a minute. This is your ticket. When you get on the bus here, the driver will take this part. You will ride to Omaha. When you get to Omaha, ask the driver. 'Salt Lake City, please. I do not speak English.'

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: 'Salt Lake City, please. I do not speak English.'

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Will you please do it my way? You'll get into trouble if you don't. If anybody talks to you, tell them... I do not speak English.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Right. In Omaha the driver will put you on the bus for Salt Lake City and the new driver will take...  ...this part. When you get to Salt Lake City, ask the driver, 'Las Vegas, please'...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: 'Las Vegas, please. I do not speak English.' What is hitchhike?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: That's your bus.  When you get to Las Vegas, ask the driver. 'Lathrop Wells, please. I do not speak English.'

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: 'Lathrop Wells, please. I do not speak English.'

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You stand on the side of the road, the highway... you understand? And you face the cars going in the direction you want to go. When you see a car or a truck coming, you stick out your thumb like this...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Your thumb tells the driver that you want a ride.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Not every car, but... a car will stop... Maybe not the first car... maybe number eight, number fifteen...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: When do I get to Lathrop Wells?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Tomorrow morning. Start hitch-hiking right away and...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: ...you'll have plenty of time to get to where you want to go.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Don't worry. They're not going to hurt you. Come on.  Only show this to the driver. Nobody else. And don't lose it.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Don't be afraid. Do what I told you and you'll be okay.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Well... I'm going to go now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Yes. I have a long ride ahead of me...  Goodbye.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'll stay till you get on the bus.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: See? You're going to be okay.

Speaker: shopkeeper
Dialogue: This kind of thing's real bad for business...

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Those kind of people should be shot.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: I think he was just lost...

Speaker: tough
Dialogue: No way he was going to get away from me.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: Where's that?... And it was one person, one way...

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Eyewitnesses are the worst. You get two of them together. You got three stories. You know what I mean?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Is there a reward in this?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Because I'm the one who called the police, you know.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Hey, it's none of my business why you're chasing a retard... You want my opinion, it's the girl. She had to hold the guy's hand all the way to the car like he was a kid.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Hey... he didn't look like no big time criminal to me.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Eh... the store tells you to call when there's trouble, so they won't get sued... But that shouldn't matter if there's a reward, right?

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: That's what I thought. So remember it was me because sometimes rewards come late, you know.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: We will.  Something's wrong here. She's helping him now.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: I know. She bought him a ticket for Lathrop Wells and put him on the bus. He didn't stay on though and they drove off together.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: Maybe he's turned her into one of them. They enter the crowd around the helicopter.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You thought we were a different planet?!

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: No. My ship was doing a map of all the suns and...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Stars... When a sun is far away, we call it a 'star.'

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: We were doing a map of the stars and all the other things up there when we saw a small ship. My... eh... we kidnapped it. On it there was a map that said how to come to Earth. This was very important. Before then, we thought we were the only people in all the stars.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You did? That's funny. So did we.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: We told our home, and the people who tell us what to do on my planet said to come and look but not to talk, not to land, not to shoot. Just to look from up there. We came and... the driver of my ship...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: The captain wanted to land to see close and to get some things from Earth to take home. The police came and shot at us. One of the people from my ship was killed.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Oh, that's terrible. I'm sorry. Was he a good friend?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: A friend is a person that is good to you... someone you like to be with... someone you like to laugh with...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: He was a good friend... The captain took the ship away fast and I was not in the ship.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: The police shouldn't have started shooting. But you can hardly blame them. You surprised them. They didn't know you were up there. When they saw you, they thought you were here to hurt us.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Sounds like your captain's going to get hell when he gets back home.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I've noticed... Do you understand what they're saying?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Not all... but it feels like a kiss.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Do you have music up there?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'd like to hear it. Can you sing something?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Don't be afraid... I'd really like to hear it.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I am not a good singer.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: What can I do for you folks?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Thirty-seven fifty for one person, forty-nine fifty for two.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You have one with two beds?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Will this be cash or credit card?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: I'll have to run your card off now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We're only going to be here a few hours...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: But I have never seen this before. I am not complete.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: You can park your car in front of the room.

Speaker: second driver
Dialogue: All anybody knows is that they're armed and dangerous.

Speaker: second officer
Dialogue: Be a piece of cake for us to take 'em.

Speaker: third driver
Dialogue: National Security folks should be here any minute. Let them take care of it. That's what they get the big bucks for.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I want a drink. May I have two quarters?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You shouldn't drink so much of that stuff. It's bad for you.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: On the radio they say it's good.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: The machine gave me two. Should I put one back?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'm not sleepy anymore. Let's drive for a little while longer.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No. I'm just not tired. Let's go.

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: One of them must be pretty badly hurt.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Get this back to the copter.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Mrs. Haydn, please come out. We don't want to hurt you or your friend. Please put down your weapon and come out.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Okay, fan out. These people have a gun but we want them alive. Understand?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Mrs. Haydn, we don't want to hurt you. Put down your gun and come out. We just want to talk to your friend.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Iron channel message. Almost caught by pursuers. This may hinder escape. Wait for me.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Don't forget to tell the boys where you had a good time.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Get me a radio. At least I won't have to look at his face.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: I'll make this as simple as I can, George. They disappeared.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: George, listen to what you're saying. This thing's changed itself into a man. Disappearing may not be that big a deal.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Maybe... look, this is just something to think about... from what I got at the shopping center, it was more scared than anything else... I don't feel it's as big a threat as you think it is...

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: I'm not being unpatriotic, and I'm doing my damndest to catch them. Bell's up on 80 and I'm down here on 70 past Grand Junction. They're heading west. If they're not flying we have a damn good chance of getting them. All I'm asking is that you people think about it.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: What the hell do you think you're doing?

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Are there any more in there?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Las Vegas, please. I do not speak English.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I can only take you to Grand Junction, but you'll have a better chance to get a ride from there.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Parlez vous Francais?... Habla Ingles?... Sprechen zie deutsch?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Good job, neither do I. What do you do for a living?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I'm a cook. Do you understand 'cook?'

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: Hey, that sounds interesting. You like it?

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: You don't get rich as a cook, either, believe me. I got a girl going to college this fall. The wife had to go back to nursing to help pay for it.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: She wants to become a doctor. She's a bright kid. Hard worker. I think she'll make it. But the damned inflation's driven the tuition up so high it makes it real tough on a family like ours.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: I got two other kids. I don't know what we'll do when they get old enough for college.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: Everybody blames it on the oil crisis. That might be where it starts. But I think a lot of people are just using that as an excuse to rip the rest of us off. I see it every day in the kitchen. Peaches. We use the gallon cans. The price has gone up three times in the last year. And now the cans are only half full.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: They're damned expensive and a pain in the ass sometimes, but I wouldn't trade having them for anything.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: What do you think of America?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: He had on tan cords, a plaid shirt and a baseball cap... probably hitchhiking.

Speaker: attendant
Dialogue: I don't pay much attention to those guys.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: In the last hour or so...

Speaker: second attendant
Dialogue: I don't know... I'm not sure. I might have seen him up the road a piece on my way in. He's long gone by now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You know if anybody here's going to Wisconsin?

Speaker: older man
Dialogue: I'm going to Des Moines. If you can wait till I finish here, you're welcome to ride along.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Could you give me the highway patrol, please?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: My name's Jenny Haydn. I think you're looking for me. I was kidnapped in Eau Claire, Wisconsin a couple of days ago. But I'm free now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Jenny Haydn. I'm on my way home and I don't want anybody I'm with shot at when you...

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: All we know right now is that it's east of here.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: This is Marc Shermin. Where are you, Mrs. Haydn?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I don't know. Someplace called Elmo's. Look, I just wanted to tell you that I'm all right and I'm on my way home.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No. You'll want to ask a lot of questions I don't want to answer right now. I already have a ride.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Is the man who kidnapped you there now?

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Get a highway patrol unit over there.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Mr... I'm sorry, what was your name again?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Mr. Shermin, I'm hanging up now. If you want to ask me any questions, call me at home in a couple of days. I'm in the book.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: He doesn't want to hurt anybody. Please leave him alone.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I need a fast ride west.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You sure this is your car?

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: Geez, Mrs. Haydn, we just got going.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I told you I'm looking for someone.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I don't know where he is.

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: This is going to be a real drag. I thought you wanted to go fast.

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: Would be kinda neat if they were. I think I could outrun them. Maybe get my picture in the papers.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: Well, here we are... You go down that ramp there, you're sure to get a ride.

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: And don't be shy about your English. You speak better than a lot of people I know.  Take care of yourself.

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: I bet you we find your friend at the roadblock.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We better find him before that.

Speaker: patrolman
Dialogue: The girl's not here, Mr. Shermin. Seems right after she talked to you, she got a ride west with a kid.

Speaker: long hair
Dialogue: Sure. Get in. We can drop you in Vegas or get you darn close.

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: I'm telling you, you're going to find him at the roadblock, or right after, or not at all.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: If he didn't want to go through the roadblock, is there any other way to get to Vegas?

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: The five-fifty. We already passed it. But it'll take him way out of his way.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Pull over. I've got to get back there.

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: Why wouldn't he want to go through the roadblock?... What did you guys do?... I won't tell anybody.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It's easier not to tell if you don't know.

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: Wait. Could I have your autograph?

Speaker: teenager
Dialogue: I have nothing to do. I'd like to help you.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Don't worry. I'll be all right.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I told you goodbye. Why are you here?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: The police are waiting for you up ahead. There's a roadblock. You have to go back.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: This car will take me to Las Vegas. I cannot go back.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: The police know about Lathrop Wells. We have to go another way. Come on.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: If I don't meet the ship, my people will go home without me.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Please understand. If you go this way, you'll never get to your ship. The police know about Lathrop Wells. We have to go another way. I'll get you to your ship. I promise.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I will go. But not you.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You shit! I'll decide if I go or not. Not you. I don't know what you do on your planet, but I didn't think that was very nice walking out on me like you did.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I don't want you to be hurt.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I didn't ask to come along on this trip, but I sure as hell am going to be the one to say when I get off.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Any sign of either of them yet?

Speaker: lyman
Dialogue: I don't think they're going to show.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Okay. Tell the highway patrol to block all major arteries off 70 from here to Elmo's.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: The Cook said I speak good English.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Why can't we wait here for a ride?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I feel better if I move.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We're hundreds of miles from where you have to be.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Even if we walk five miles, it's not going to make any difference.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We're not going to get a ride tonight.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I can't stay on this planet.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No one's traveling in this weather.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: You promised you would get me to my ship.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I will. I will. We still have another day.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: What do you want from me? There are no cars on this road. I didn't ask for this stupid storm.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: You can stop. I will go on alone.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We're too far away to walk. Don't you understand?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I can't stay here. I want to go home. I don't want this skin. I don't want to look like this.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Why don't you send one of your radio balloons and tell your captain that you might be late?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I used the last one to jump off the cliff...

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Let's find a place out of the rain. I'm sure we'll get a ride in the morning.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I can't be late. I don't know if the radio balloons work above your planet. I don't know if my words went to the ship. If I'm not there, the captain will think I'm dead and go.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: We'll get a ride in the morning.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Oh, you're warm... put your arms around me.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You don't forget anything, do you?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Hello... hello. How are you this morning?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: No, they don't talk... We talk to them.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I gave you a baby last night.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: You have been very good to me, Jennyhaydn.  You said you wanted a baby, so I gave you one.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: It will be human and it will look like this.  But when it comes it will know everything I know and everything you know. That is something from my planet that I want your baby to have.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I told you it's impossible for me to have a baby.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: You will have this baby. If you want it. If you don't, I can stop it now.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: We have a new directive. I'm taking over.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: We don't have to do it that way. We can catch him this time.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Washington thinks it's too late for that.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: I've never been taken off an assignment in my life. Give me twenty- four hours and I'll have him for you.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: You can change a directive, George. You've done it before. Listen to me. He's going somewhere in Death Valley. Lathrop Wells was never anything but a bus stop. East is the nuclear site. There are no roads in there. She was teaching him to hitchhike. I'm telling you. We block the four roads into Death Valley and we got him.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: We'll do that. But how are we going to hold him? He can change himself into a man. He can disappear.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: That's the chance we have to take.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: Then you're going to have to do it without me.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: You're a career intelligence officer, Shermin. You'll be in the air with us.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: You're talking about taking a life. The most unique life form on this planet. I think we're better than that.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: The cowboys were right. You can make money fast gambling.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You don't make money gambling. You lose it.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: May I have twenty-five cents, please?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Here are two quarters. When you lose these, you're not going to get anymore.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: This is crazy. We don't have time for this.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I know how to gamble now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You won ten dollars. Big deal. If we don't get a good ride before dark we could miss your ship.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I want to get money for you and the baby.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I don't need any money for the baby. I'll be fine.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Inflation, tuition, college. Children are damned expensive. I know.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: If I ever run into that guy, I'm going to kick his ass.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It'll tell you pretty much everything about us...

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: This is very interesting. We are born knowing our history. We have other books. But not a book like this.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Any words you don't know you can find in the dictionary.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: It'll give you the different countries, how they came to be, what they are now, how America came to be, the governments, the languages... everything.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Many of my people will not believe those things are possible. On my planet there is only one government, one people, one language. I will be asked a lot of questions.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: What will you say about us?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I will say that we can be friends.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: If you want to keep it, you can.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Would you put some of your singing in this for the baby?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: You want the baby to laugh at me.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: How long will it take you to get home?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Would you like to listen to some music?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'm sure we could find a country and western station.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Don't worry. Everything's going to be fine.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Oh, wow... I'll tell you what. When the baby is born, we'll go out in my back yard and wave to you.

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: You can speak to me, Mrs. Haydn. I'm in charge of this operation now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: If I don't speak to Mr. Shermin, I'm hanging up.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Mr. Shermin wants to speak to you.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: We can't let you do that.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: Where do you think you're going?

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: Thank you, Jennyhaydn. You are good. I must go alone now.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I said I would get you to your ship and that's where we're going to say goodbye.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: I do not know how many times I can do this.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: If my ship is not here, we are in trouble.

Speaker: star man
Dialogue: That's where we landed last time. Right under that mountain.

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I won't let anyone hurt you.

Speaker: shermin
Dialogue: George... Do you hear me, George?

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: You say you love me and kiss me 'goodbye.'

Speaker: jenny
Dialogue: I'm never going to see you again, am I?
